result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santino A Luciano

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Prelim on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 10/07/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH D.Y.D. dob 4-14-1977. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST CONTINUE TO ENGAGE IN TREATMENT.

Defendant Santino A Luciano in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Santino A Luciano.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Uzowulu. Bond modified to no violent contact. Minutes filed.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

Defendant Santino A Luciano in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Santino A Luciano.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present and makes statement. Complaint read by court. Charges and penalties explained. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Bond motion hearing set. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Santino A Luciano not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Santino A Luciano. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 10/07/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH D.Y.D. dob 4-14-1977. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST CONTINUE TO ENGAGE IN TREATMENT.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.Y.D. dob 4-14-1977 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 1:25 PM. Defendant Santino A Luciano in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu for bond purposes only. Discussion as to bond. Bond set at $1500 cash. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
